how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: It's the right fit for a personal information manager that I can adapt to make it useful for any use cases I throw at it (given enough effort)
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you back up/sync changes between: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Too many to list, I'm an avid tinkerer of my base TW.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: The community is very friendly and engaging and support is easy to find. New plugins are infrequent, but rarely become obsolete, which is a huge plus compared to other projects of similar sizes.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I'm finding difficulties with more advanced "nice to haves" such as publishing via a SSG, sync over several devices, and seamlessly including images.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
